model_info.name: test_seawat
model_info.title: SEAWAT Density-Dependent Flow and Transport Demonstration
model_info.description: Comprehensive demonstration of SEAWAT capabilities for coupled groundwater flow and transport modeling with variable density effects using the classic Henry saltwater intrusion problem.

learning_objectives: Configure SEAWAT models for saltwater intrusion studies
Set up the Henry problem benchmark configuration
Apply Variable Density Flow (VDF) package parameters
Design source/sink mixing for transport boundary conditions
Integrate MODFLOW flow with MT3D transport models
Apply SEAWAT to professional coastal aquifer problems

Seawat.purpose: Primary model container for density-dependent flow

SeawatVdf.purpose: Variable Density Flow package for buoyancy effects

SeawatVsc.purpose: Variable Viscosity package for temperature/concentration effects

ModflowDis.purpose: Model discretization in space and time

ModflowLpf.purpose: Layer Property Flow for hydraulic properties

Mt3dBtn.purpose: Basic Transport package for concentration simulation

1_grid_generation.description: 2D cross-sectional grid for Henry problem geometry

2_model_setup.description: Coupled SEAWAT model with flow and transport components
2_model_setup.educational_focus: Model coupling and hydraulic property assignment

3_initial_conditions.description: Initial salinity distribution and hydraulic heads

4_boundary_conditions.description: Freshwater inflow and seawater boundary conditions
4_boundary_conditions.educational_focus: Coupled flow and transport boundary conditions

5_solver.description: Iterative solvers for coupled flow and transport

6_visualization.description: Output control for heads, concentrations, and budgets

7_post_processing.description: Variable density flow analysis and interface delineation

professional_applications: Coastal aquifer management and saltwater intrusion prevention
Well field design optimization to prevent saline upconing
Sea level rise impact assessment on freshwater resources
Artificial recharge system design for freshwater barriers
Geothermal system analysis with thermal convection
Mine dewatering operations with high-salinity groundwater
Industrial brine disposal and injection system design

technical_notes.density_coupling: Linear relationship between concentration and fluid density
technical_notes.numerical_stability: Small time steps required for density-driven flow stability
technical_notes.grid_requirements: High vertical resolution needed to capture interface dynamics
technical_notes.convergence_criteria: Iterative coupling requires tight convergence tolerances
technical_notes.benchmark_significance: Henry problem provides analytical solution for validation
technical_notes.professional_standards: Industry-standard approach for saltwater intrusion studies

henry_problem_details.problem_significance: Classical benchmark for variable density flow codes
henry_problem_details.physical_representation: Freshwater discharge creating lens above denser seawater

expected_behavior.interface_formation: Sharp transition between fresh and saline water
expected_behavior.steady_state: Interface position depends on discharge rate
expected_behavior.mass_balance: Conservation of both flow and solute mass

validation_framework.expected: Proper freshwater inflow and seawater boundaries
validation_framework.description: Validates coupled flow and transport boundary conditions

qa_information.testing_notes: Demonstrates SEAWAT model configuration without requiring executable
